item.title: Using Z in Vim
item.description: The Z script is a popular utility for directory-hopping on Unix-y systems (popular alternatives include fasd and autojump). It tracks visited directories, and, when invoked with a directory substring, jumps to a matching directory; when presented with multiple matches, it jumps to the first match from its ‘frecency’ algorithm. So if you’re in your ~/Documents directory and want to jump to your ~/go/src/ directory, you can jump by simply entering z src.
